The best base iPhone Apple has ever released. It was about damn time they added a ProMotion display. Apple also giving the iPhone 17 Pro upgrades like the improved selfie camera, upgraded main cameras to 48MP on both lenses, an anti-reflective coating, and starting at 256GB for the same price as the iPhone 16 last year makes this phone absolutely incredible. The colors are great as well. I have the Sage color, and it looks really good. I upgraded from the 14 Pro and I’m glad I did, especially because I saved so much money thanks to how good the base version is

Good summary. 13 mini user here. I'm still happy, or at least I was until Apple forced iOS 26 on me. We'll see how that goes. I charge it on a magsafe stand overnight or magsafe in the car, so 15W / lightning really aren't a huge deal, it lasts me well enough. I use an iPad for a lot of things, so the phone doesn't get used a ton, certainly not doom scrolling. I have a small magsafe battery from baseus which can fully charge it in a pinch, and that's in my bag just in case, but I've only needed it once. I really don't care about Apple Intelligence today, maybe if that gets better, but I'm not holding my breath. I'd like better cameras, and a better display wouldn't hurt. Useful Siri would probably clinch the deal. But I love the mini form factor, I'm really not looking forward to carrying a bigger/heavier phone. My next iPhone will likely be the 17, the improvements over the 16 are compelling.
From 11 pro to 17 and I already love it
I switched to 17 from 12 ProMax , no regrets.

I was locked for base 17 but now I’m seeing comparison videos of 17 zoomed photos and 17 Pro zoomed photos and that telephoto camera really makes a difference. Also night time photos look better on Pro. I like taking pictures when I’m travelling or few videos when I’m at concert and I tend to use zoom way more than ultrawide. For the reference I have base 11 and I still think those cameras hold up but zoom and night time photos just suck. Slightly bigger battery, vapor chamber and slightly better processor is good as well but basically I only need telephoto camera from Pro but is it worth it extra 300.. need to decide until next weekend when imma go buy either 17 or 17 Pro.

11:40, while the storage argument is valid if you only buy new, people should seriously consider buying used for big local storage upgrades.

Also, definitely worth considering getting an old mac mini or macbook and just using it as a backup computer with phone data and photo backups. like a $100 2015 macbook pro with 256-512gb of fast storage to offload pics, instead of paying $100 extra to go from a used base 15 Pro Max to a 1TB 15 pro max, for instance.

Also, worth considering getting a used 15 pro or pro max instead of the 17. But i get it if you just prefer new. Just imo, I'd rather have the pro phone, 3 cameras, all for $200-300 less.
Coming from the base 15 to the 17 pro, there’s a notable upgrade. So I would say even 2 years you’re going to get a decent upgrade

interesting comparison, thanks. just a small thing, but if you pay for applecare for your phone, it's worth getting the battery replaced when it has seriously degraded. costs nothing and is an easy way to utilise all those monthly direct debit payments for the policy. i did it with my 13 mini and it totally gave the phone a new lease of life for an extra ~1.5 years. i think in most people's phone life-cycle, that's a respectable extension!
